meanings.sent1: I always preplan my outfits for the week on Sunday.
meanings.sent2: It is important to preplan your route before going on a road trip.
meanings.sent3: Trying to preplan a surprise party for my friend was tricky but fun.
meanings.sent4: She decided to preplan her study schedule like a military operation.
meanings.sent5: The event coordinator preplanned every detail of the conference to perfection.

meanings.sent1: Having a preplan in place helped us respond quickly to the emergency.
meanings.sent2: The team discussed the preplan for the project during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The preplan for the party included a backup venue in case of rain.
meanings.sent4: His preplan for retirement involved saving a portion of his salary each month.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's preplan for the field trip ensured all students were accounted for.
